unnormalised: **Logistics Delays Hamper Diwali Product Delivery, Say Manufacturers**
normalised: **Logistics Delays Hamper Diwali Product Delivery, Say Manufacturers**

unnormalised: Mumbai: Manufacturing firms across Maharashtra are facing significant logistics delays, threatening timely delivery of Diwali goods. A shortage of truck drivers and increased port congestion at Nhava Sheva are cited as primary factors.
normalised: Mumbai: Manufacturing firms across Maharashtra are facing significant logistics delays, threatening timely delivery of Diwali goods. A shortage of truck drivers and increased port congestion at N-H-A-V-A Sheva are cited as primary factors.

unnormalised: Dr. Ravi Kumar, President of the All India Manufacturing Association (AIMA), stated that delays averaging 7-10 days are impacting shipments, particularly in the apparel and electronics sectors. "Many retailers in cities like Nagpur and Pune are worried about receiving their stock on time," he added.
normalised: Doctor Ravi Kumar, President of the All India Manufacturing Association (A-I-M-A), stated that delays averaging seven to ten days are impacting shipments, particularly in the apparel and electronics sectors. "Many retailers in cities like Nagpur and Pune are worried about receiving their stock on time," he added.

unnormalised: Rising fuel costs and toll taxes are also exacerbating the situation, driving up transportation costs by approximately Rs. 5 per km. This translates to a significant impact on smaller businesses operating on thin margins.
normalised: Rising fuel costs and toll taxes are also exacerbating the situation, driving up transportation costs by approximately rupee five per kilometer. This translates to a significant impact on smaller businesses operating on thin margins.

unnormalised: Furthermore, warehousing space is becoming increasingly scarce, especially around key industrial hubs. Reports indicate that rents for prime warehouse space are up 15% in the last quarter, reaching Rs. 35 per sq ft in some areas. The delays are expected to affect the sale of traditional Diwali items and mithai as well. The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) is urging the government to intervene and address the infrastructure bottlenecks to avoid significant economic losses.
normalised: Furthermore, warehousing space is becoming increasingly scarce, especially around key industrial hubs. Reports indicate that rents for prime warehouse space are up fifteen percent in the last quarter, reaching rupee thirty five per square foot in some areas. The delays are expected to affect the sale of traditional Diwali items and mithai as well. The Confederation of Indian Industry (C-I-I) is urging the government to intervene and address the infrastructure bottlenecks to avoid significant economic losses.
